text:
This is a 55 yr male w/ hx MM, S/P cord tx s/p  >100 days. Course c/b
   CMV viremia, hepatic GVHD, ARF, and hemolysis. Pt has Pt had developed
   bleed s/p transjugular biopsy w/ hct drop despite PRBC. Hct bumped
   appropriately after transfusions yesterday and overnoc. Pt is followed
   by surgery and IR; however, there is no plan for acute intervention at
   this time.
   Anemia, acute, secondary to blood loss (Hemorrhage, Bleeding)
   Assessment:
   Hct 27.5 up from 25.4 s/p receiving 1 unit PRBC overnoc.
   Action:
   Following CBC as ordered. Monitoring hemodynamic status. Monitoring for
   s/s active bleeding. Supporting pt w/ blood products as indicated and
   ordered
 pt has not had any transfusion requirements this shift.
   Response:
   HR 80
s to low 100
s w/ activity
 no significant ectopy. BP remains
   stable. Pt remains free of s/s active bleeding.
   Plan:
   Repeat CBC to be checked at 1600. Continue to monitor hemodynamics and
   for s/s active bleeding. Goal hct >27.
   Thrombocytopenia, chronic
   Assessment:
   Pt continues w/ thrombocytopenia w/ plt count 54 this am, down from 93
   on previous count. Pt received plt transfusion over noc.
   Action:
   Continue to monitor platelet counts as ordered. Following hemodynamic
   status and monitoring for s/s active bleeding as above.
   Response:
   Pt remains free of s/s active bleeding. Platelets currently within
   acceptable range >50 per team. No platelet transfusion requirements
   this shift.
   Plan:
   Repeat CBC to be checked at 1600 as above. Continue to monitor
   hemodynaics and for s/s active bleeding. Goal platelets >50 per team.
   .H/O abdominal pain (including abdominal tenderness)
   Assessment:
   Pt continues to report intermittent RUQ pain. Now receiving MS contin
   15mg PO BID w/ good effect. Pt has required little treatment for
   breakthrough pain.
   Action:
   Following pain assessment. Administering MS contin as ordered.
   Implementing non-pharmacological intervention for pain management as
   indicated.
   Response:
   Pain well controlled per pt
s report. Pt reports pain remains 0-3 on
   current regimen.
   Plan:
   Continue current regimen as ordered.
   K w/ am labs 5.5. Pt continues w/ good UOP despite slight increase in
   creatanine. Repeat labs sent and pnd. No need for EKG at this time per
   team. Following lytes. If K remains elevated, plan to send urine lytes.
   If K further elevated plan EKG.
   FSBS has been trending low in am
 62 this am
 up to 210 s/p receiving
 amp D50. Insulin in TPN to be adjusted. Currently following FSBS and
   treating accordingly.
   Pt continues on cyclosporine, Cell-cept, Caspofungin, and ursodial.
   Given 1 dose acyclovir w/ further dosing pnd BMT req
   Pt remains afebrile. Remains lethargic though easily arousable, OX3,
   able to dangle legs at bedside w/ assist to use urinal. Continues w/
   generalized weakness. BMT and fall precautions maintained.
